p: The results suggest that historical 1,000‐year events will occur 2–5 times more frequently under 2 °C warming (depending on the region). Under 4 °C of warming (for those models which reach that level under RCP8.5), a present‐day 1,000‐year event is projected to be 5–10 times more frequent. The greatest increase in frequency is seen in the U.S. East Coast, the Southern Great Plains, and southern Rocky Mountain clusters (illustrated on a map of the continental United States in Figure 3).
